title: spack env create myenv spack.yaml -- broken?
body:
I have been using Spack happily for a few years now, and today I decided to try out spack  environments, which are new to me.  I'm not sure if this issue is a bug report or just a request to improve the documentation.

I want to be able to create and environment, install some software, and then copy the `spack.yaml` and/or `spack.lock` files to another system, and reproducibly build the same environment.

I'm starting from a clean slate:
```shell
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ export SPACK_ROOT="$(pwd)/spack"
$ source "${SPACK_ROOT}/share/spack/setup-env.sh"
```

Here is my simple `spack.yaml`
```yaml
spack:
  specs:
    - python@3.7.6
    - bwa@0.7.17
    - flash@1.2.11
    - fastqc@0.11.7
    - py-multiqc@1.7
    - rabbitmq@3.6.15
    - postgresql@11.2
  view: true
```

The [docs](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/environments.html#creating-a-named-environment) say:

> Spack Environments can also be created from either a `spack.yaml` manifest or a `spack.lock` lockfile. To create an Environment from a `spack.yaml` manifest:
> ```
> $ spack env create myenv spack.yaml
> ```
> To create an Environment from a spack.lock lockfile:
> ```
> $ spack env create myenv spack.lock
> ```

Based on this, I assume the `spack env create myenv spack.yaml` will create an environment named `myenv`, copy the spec (or lock) file into it, **and install the packages**.  However, when I try it, all that happens is:

```
$ spack env create myenv spack.yaml 
==> Updating view at /home/user/spack/var/spack/environments/myenv/.spack-env/view
==> Created environment 'myenv' in /home/user/spack/var/spack/environments/myenv
```

This takes less than 1 second, and nothing is installed.  I get exactly the same behavior when I try using the `spack.lock` file.

Am I misunderstanding the point of this command?  Is there a follow-on command to get All the Things installed?  If so, perhaps this should be added to the above documentation.  Apologies in advance if I am being dense and missing something.

BTW, I notice that the path `/home/user/spack/var/spack/environments/myenv` (where spack claimed it was "updating view") does not contain any `.spack-env` dir.  All that is there is a copy of the yaml file:
```
ls -a /home/user/spack/var/spack/environments/myenv/
.  ..  spack.yaml
```

I am using spack at the current HEAD of develop:  cacd57d3401c48490870df2a9c1b7ab51d0e5065
